caption: I love their chicken satay more than anything. They have a menu with lots of options. I also like the baked goods and snacks they have when you go inside. But their prices are a bit high compared to other Thai restaurants in the area.
Workers are not vey nice. They did not seem to care about customers. Not very helpful. I would not recommend that place.
Great experience, communication and service. thank you
Amazing Panang Curry, Pad See Ew, and Pad Thai! Great mango smoothies as well!
Panang Curry very tasty, and the best Sticky Rice
So far the best Thai i have found in Chicago.  Friendly staff and if you want it be spicy, prepare to sweat from your eyebrows.

Hit or miss type of place. I ordered here from Doordash a month ago and had a delicious meal, got the pad Thai and the egg rolls. Today I decided to go on person to order since I'm trying to support local restaurants. I got the pad Thai again, Kao Soi - asked to replace the chicken for beef and paid extra $2 for substitution, and a Thai vet shrimp roll. The Thai did not have any flavor and there was way less vegetables than the last time. The Kao Soi came with chicken even after I've paid $2 more and it was not good (watery curry, no season, and the noodle taste like instant noodles), and even the Thai roll was not good (we could barely taste any shrimp!) I'm not sure what happened tonight - maybe they changed the chef, but I like to have consistency when ordering food! Also it's not cheap ($50 for an appetizer and 2 dishes which is a lot for a Thai restaurant in Chicago). Not planning in come back at this place and wouldn't recommend...
Delicious but expensive. Small portions
Ordered some panang curry with tofu a few days ago and it was absolutely delicious. Came with a perfect amount of food and plenty of veggies and tofu in it.
Consistently delicious variety of Thai cuisine.

My first time ordering from here and I will be ordering again. Best Beef Pad Thai I’ve had in a while, and they give you so much! Had the cucumber salad as well, tasted great and also the portion the give you is enough for 2 people. Very satisfied with this place !

As a restauranteur for 35 years I don’t appreciate to be yelled at by the restaurant owner because I asked for bamboo shoots only in my green Curry. That’s the way I like it and am more then willing to pay for it. We all work Extremely hard in this industry and it’s a 24/7  business. I have always catered to what ever my customers needed and will continue to do so. If you can’t take the heat get out off the business. Your food is excellent although i believe it’s the last time i ever order from your establishment again. Don’t dictate to you customers, unless they are unreasonable.
Fantastic..

I came with a friend to Thai Pastry and the lunch menu is $8.50 for soup, small appetizer and a small entree. There are about 18 entrees to choose from rice or noodles with beef, chicken, shrimp or tofu. Shrimp is $1.50 extra and it is frozen not fresh. I ordered the panang curry and it was great. The basil chicken was so so. For dessert we ordered pág is like a flan in texture and color. It was very good served warm. Service is average but it balances with the awesome price. Decoration is with plastic flowers and gold bird cages. One strong advise bring cash and your life will be easier at Thai Pastry. Take a Pastry home with cash only.

I've tried a ton of thai restaurants in the Uptown, Ravenswood, Lakeview, and Lincoln Square neighborhoods (not to mention a pretty robust tour of most Evanston thai restaurants) and this is far and away the best choice. Great prices, friendly staff, quiet, unassuming.  On the outside, it doesnt have the flash or kitsch that a lot of the Asia on Argyle restaurants have. However, it is one of the best restaurants on the strip food-wise. Really fresh ingredients and great levels of spice. Can not recommend enough.  Pro tip: they have a really reasonable lunch special.
Horrible service- extremely rude, way overpriced for below average food, decor is anxiety inducing. Overall bad experience.

First of all, I am from Thailand. I am seeking for only the authentic Thai food in USA. I have been trying many Thai restaurants in Chicago and most of them can cook the simple Thai dishes and it tastes pretty good but to make a complicated dishes such as the southern Thai food is rarely to find one on the menu of the Thai restaurant. Today I had ordered “The Boat noodle soup “aka- Thai Pho” it was Wow!! moreover than that there was a Dry Chili powder (looks alike a cayenne peppers) as an option on the side for who loves real Thai spicy. This chili has made in house by owner. Lastly, I have to thanks for the humbleness of the thai owner who came checking the foods and services and brought us a Mango with the sweet sticky rice which his chef made on the house. I was really surprised with all these outcomes  and great experiences. I walked passing by this place a million times and never cared to check it out because of I judged the book by the cover😕 I didn’t wait to order some more back home for my husband to try them including the dessert that I just tried. Recommend to try this real Thai food!  ขอบคุณนะค่ะวันนี้ที่ต้อนรับอย่างดี

Whenever I come to Chicago the first (and most frequent) place I go is Thai Pastry. They have delicious, simple soups that are so grounding and warming and delicious after traveling. It’s a pretty quiet spot and they’re super lovely and helpful. I haven’t tried anything but their soups (try the ground chicken with glass noodle soup!), but I highly recommend it.
Great lunch specials Love this little hidden treasure
Great authentic thai food with reasonable price. Thai duck curry,nam tok beef salad is the bomb..
Great food, portions are decent.
Important to note that pastry and ice cream purchases are *cash only*. Lovely Thai custard and one of the few places to find red bean ice cream. Great, fast service.
Incredibly kind staff. Excellent food!  There are only a handful of places in this area that are as treasured as this. The atmosphere is peaceful Zen. Highly recommended.
The dishes were too small. Had to order two entrees just for myself to feel satisfied. It is really too bad! This used to be one of my favorite places for Thai food.
I am glad to found this place. Big portion and delicious. They also have the Lunch special . Yum!

Ordered coconut pineapple smoothies.. WORST smoothies ever! Couldn't even finish a third of it. They have this extremely weird aftertaste but then also has a ton of sugar that I honestly felt like I'd get a diabetic shock if I did finish it. So if that wasn't enough, they are expensive as hell at $6.95. I am normally not stingy but when it tastes horrible and it's expensive -  that will have me not returning.

I ordered more than $60 delivery. Apparently the entrees don't come with rice. That is an extra charge. Extremely overpriced for not a lot of food. When I called to ask about the rice they were rude, and then they called me back to tell me the exact same thing they told me in the first call. Huge waste of money. Very disappointing. And why would a curry just come with meat and sauce and NO RICE? Awful experience.
Very friendly staff. I have had meals here countless times. Very delicious food and they have very friendly prices.
My top choice for quality Thai food in Chicago! Excellent curries.
Great vegan options
Very nice place and good Thai restaurants
Delicious

My favorite Thai Place in Chicago. Been eating here for about 10 years, at least. The best crab rangoon in the city. Puffy pillows of crab, water chestnuts and cream cheese with crispy edges and lots of flavor. Great lunch specials and it's BYOB.
Delicious red curry!!
My first time visiting this restaurant Found the food to be a very good quality. But some items seem to be a little overpriced for what they give you.
Always great service, good food and price.
The food is delicious. I have been coming for years and never disappointed.
Authentic dishes from Thailand I rarely see and the food was  Delicious!
Super friendly crew, the lunch special includes soup, appetizer, and dessert! The food is decent and I'd love to check other menu items.
Don't get any of the fried menu items. The wantons were completely empty, just fried dough. I paid $30 for a meal that by the end of it wished I never ordered.
I've been to Thai restaurants all over the city and Thai Pastry is by far my favorite place. Every dish I've had has been great!
Terrific little restaurant that turns out some of the best curries. Also great spring rolls.
Used to love this place, but food quality is uneven. The fish dishes do not taste fresh. Lemon chicken still great, however.
Very good, very friendly. They have traditional dishes and will actually make them spicy!
My husband and I go here often and their pick-up service is fast. The pineapple fried-rice is one of our favorites.
The food is amazing.  Had "Basil on Rice" with beef and it was wonderful. The atmosphere is a bit cluttered, but otherwise great food!
I've loved and enjoyed every meal. Worth the 90 minute trip from Kankakee!
Good food, but be aware of minimum for credit card payments.
Decent food, funky interior.

The food was very good. The owners were very nice and appreciate my attempt at the Thai language.  Most importantly is that the food was good and reasonably priced. The had some pasteries as well. The looked good, but I can't eat sugar.

I love their bubble tea. The curries are really good, pad Thai is not as good as some other places I have been in Chicago but there is a lot of really good Thai in Chicago so that's not a bad thing. I would recommend sticking to the curry dishes and appetizers.
So bad service.
Perfect food and service in a gorgeous setting—can't wait to go back!
Long time favorite.
I come here once or twice a month, one of the best places for Thai food. Service is great, delicious food, place is always clean and usually quiet.
I absolutely love this place my friends and I frequent this restaurant at least 4 - 5 times a month
Taste is good.
I'm a regular here.  Love the pineapple fired rice! Great food and great service.

I ordered food to be delivered and was going to pay with my visa when the driver arrived, which is one of the options offered. When the driver arrived, he was very rude and told me that I could only pay with cash. I told him I was paying with visa card, he grabbed the food from me and walked out. I called to complain and told the driver to come back and expected me to pay full price.  DO NOT ORDER FROM THIS PLACE! Food is decent at best. Plenty of other better Thai places to choose from.

my dining experience blew me away. I chanced into the restaurant on a snowy day just looking for something to fill the void. instead I had an amazing experience. the place is clean and very welcoming. I was greater with a smile. the  the lunch special was a great price and a large portion. I had the basil chicken. the soup of the day was Delecious... chicken noodle I believe and the presentation was awesome. even the way the silverware was wrapped was thoughtful. I had more smiles from the lady serving me to last the entire week. they even game me a free dessert which was served chilled and was outstanding. I  cannot wait until my next time in Chicago, I will definitely return.
Best thai restaurant in chicago!

I was impressed with Thai Pastry. We ventured up a few days ago to check out out this place in the mini rain storm. Service was great, the food was on point and the the tiny free coconut flavored dessert put a smile on my face. Can't say that this was the best I've had. That title still belongs to Ping Pong Thai Restaurant in Las Vegas.  After lunch we checked out the pastries, they appeared to be repackaged pastries so we didn't bother. Though we asked if they had samples available to try---they don't. Oh well.
great food wondeful pricers and a good atmospher and friendly service whats not to like.

they have the best lime chicken. the service is the best. they make you feel at home. the food is awesome. very delicious.. i have been in this restaurant for more that 20 times and always i enjoy every visit. i recommended the place to my friends and they all loved it too.
Excellent food, excellent flavors, decent portions.
Awesome Thai food!  Their Crab fried rice is amazing, and their servers always remember who I am.  Nice to have that kind of recognition.
